paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2 gene and specifically the G572R variant associated with Long QT syndrome type 2 (LQT2). It provides insights into the functional effects of the variant and potential therapeutic interventions.

functional_data.summary: The G572R variant causes hERG transport disorders by stimulating the endoplasmic reticulum stress (ERS) response.

variants.segregation_data: The G572R variant is a Mendelian inherited disease and exhibits a dominant negative effect when coexpressed with the wild type.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on functional assays and clinical correlation with LQT2.
variants.additional_notes: The study suggests that 4-PBA may be a therapeutic agent for correcting the transport defects caused by the G572R variant.
key_quotes: hERG mutations in LQT2 cause hERG transport disorders by stimulating the endoplasmic reticulum stress (ERS) response, such as point mutation hERG/G572R.

hERG/G572R is a Mendelian inherited disease, and when mutated genes are coexpressed with normally functioning wild type (WT) gene subunits to form alleles, they cause a significant dominant negative suppressor effect.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the KCNH2 gene and its G572R variant.
